intro: Cephaelis nuda, commonly known as the naked cephaelis, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
